Batik Semakin Dikenal di Rusia
04 Nov 2019, 16:07 by Retno M



Batik Semakin Dikenal di Rusia



Batik Semakin Dikenal di Rusia


KBRN, Moskow : Batik sebenarnya sudah cukup dikenal di Rusia dan dipelajari sebagai suatu pendidikan seni, bahkan 4 tahun yang lalu telah berdiri Sekolah Batik Moskow. Sekolah ini didirikan oleh Nadezhda Ulumbekova, warga Rusia yang mengaku telah mulai mempelajari batik sejak 22 tahun yang lalu ketika ia belajar di Sekolah Seni di Moskow.
Hal itu terungkap dalam pertemuan dengan Duta Besar RI untuk Rusia merangkap Belarus, M. Wahid Supriyadi, bersama Nadezhda.
Pada rilis yang diterima redaksi RRI, Senin (4/11/2019), disebutkan pertemuan tersebut berlangsung pada 30 Oktober lalu. Nadezhda bahkan mengakui kekagumannya pada batik, khususya batik dari Indonesia yang sangat khusus dan pengerjaannya sangat rumit.
Menurut Nadezhda, batik Indonesia sangat bagus dan menarik dengan aneka ragam corak. Ketertarikan terhadap batik Indonesia semakin besar setelah dia mengikuti workshop batik yang diselenggarakan selama Festival Indonesia di Moskow, dan pada Festival Indonesia keempat awal Agustus lalu dia diberi kesempatan untuk berpartisiasi.
“Dengan mengetahui batik Indonesia saya dapat menambah wawasan dan berbagi pengetahuan kepada murid-murid saya tentang batik,” kata Nadezhda yang sejak kecil mempelajari dan menggemari seni lukis.
Nadezhda menuturkan bahwa batik di Rusia berbeda dengan batik Indonesia yang merupakan seni tradisional yang dibuat dengan canting dan batik juga sebagai pakaian keseharian. Batik di Rusia adalah salah satu aliran dalam seni yang memiliki banyak penggemar.
“Kami menggunakan teknik cold batik, yaitu dengan cara melukis langsung pada bahan/kain,” ujar Nadezhda sambil memperlihatkan karya-karya seni batiknya kepada Dubes Wahid.
 Yang unik, di sekolahnya kebanyakan dia mengajarkannya secara online sejak tahun 2015. Pesertanya banyak yang tidak hanya dari Rusia, tetapi juga orang Rusia yang tinggal di berbagai negara, seperti Perancis, Jepang, Kanada, Italia, dan Lithuania. Nadezhda juga aktif memperkenalkan dan berkomunikasi dengan publik mengenai batik karyanya melalui berbagai media sosial yang pengikutnya cukup banyak. Karya seni batik yang dibuat terutama untuk dekorasi, lukisan kain, pakaian dan barang-barang interior.
Dubes Wahid mengemukakan bahwa batik adalah warisan leluhur bangsa Indonesia yang memiliki keanearagaman motif. Batik tersebar di seluruh daerah Indonesia dan ragam batik ada yang berupa batik tulis, batik cap, dan batik cetak (printing).
“Kita bisa lihat batik dari titik-titik lukisannya seperti ini,” kata Dubes Wahid kepada Nadezhda sambil menunjukan jaket batik kreasi salah satu desainer Indonesia, Ferry Sunarto, yang dikenakannya.
Dubes Wahid mendukung keinginan Nadezhda berkunjung ke Indonesia untuk mengetahui batik Indonesia. Dubes Wahid berharap Nadezhda dapat turut lebih memperkenalkan batik Indonesia di Rusia yang saat ini sudah mulai dikenal. Menurut Dubes Wahid, penyelenggaraan empat kali Festival Indonesia di Moskow berdampak besar pada promosi batik Indonesia di Rusia.
“Diharapkan batik Indonesia semakin diminati di Rusia, baik untuk aksesoris, seni, atau hiasan interior, termasuk pakaian. Diharapkan juga ke depan terdapat butik-butik batik di Rusia,” tegas Dubes Wahid.

Batik is increasingly known in Russia
Nov 04 2019, 16:07 by Retno M



Batik is increasingly known in Russia



Batik is increasingly known in Russia


KBRN, Moscow: Batik is already quite well known in Russia and is studied as an art education, even 4 years ago the Moscow Batik School was established. The school was founded by Nadezhda Ulumbekova, a Russian citizen who claimed to have started studying batik 22 years ago when he studied at the Art School in Moscow.
This was revealed in a meeting with the Indonesian Ambassador to Russia and Belarus, M. Wahid Supriyadi, along with Nadezhda.
In the release received by the RRI editorial, Monday (11/04/2019), it was mentioned that the meeting took place on 30 October. Nadezhda even admits his admiration for batik, especially batik from Indonesia which is very special and the process is very complicated.
According to Nadezhda, Indonesian batik is very good and attractive with a variety of patterns. His interest in Indonesian batik grew even greater after he attended a batik workshop held during the Indonesian Festival in Moscow, and at the fourth Indonesian Festival in early August he was given the opportunity to participate.
"By knowing Indonesian batik I can broaden my horizons and share knowledge with my students about batik," said Nadezhda, who since childhood studied and enjoyed painting.
Nadezhda said that batik in Russia is different from Indonesian batik, which is a traditional art made with canting and batik as well as everyday clothing. Batik in Russia is one genre in art that has many fans.
"We use cold batik techniques, namely by painting directly on material / fabric," Nadezhda said while showing his batik works to Ambassador Wahid.
What is unique, at most schools he taught it online since 2015. Many of the participants were not only from Russia, but also Russians living in various countries, such as France, Japan, Canada, Italy, and Lithuania. Nadezhda also actively introduces and communicates with the public about his batik work through various social media which has quite a large following. Batik artwork created especially for decoration, fabric paintings, clothing and interior items.
Ambassador Wahid argued that batik was the legacy of Indonesia's ancestors who had a variety of motives. Batik is spread throughout Indonesia and there are various kinds of batik in the form of written batik, printed batik, and printed batik (printing).
"We can see batik from the points of his paintings like this," Ambassador Wahid told Nadezhda while showing the batik jacket created by one of Indonesia's designers, Ferry Sunarto, which he wore.
Ambassador Wahid supported Nadezhda's desire to visit Indonesia to learn about Indonesian batik. Ambassador Wahid hoped that Nadezhda could help introduce Indonesian batik in Russia, which is now well known. According to Ambassador Wahid, the holding of the Indonesian Festival four times in Moscow had a major impact on the promotion of Indonesian batik in Russia.
"It is hoped that Indonesian batik will be increasingly in demand in Russia, both for accessories, art, or interior decoration, including clothing. It is also hoped that in the future there will be batik boutiques in Russia, "Ambassador Wahid stressed.
